name: Scribe Ibsen

topics.response_text: I'll track the virus from over here. You just concentrate on locating the terminals hosting it.
Yeah, I'm in charge of keeping this data system up and running, but accessing it is a little, ah, touch and go at the moment.
One of our exploratory patrols - back when we had exploratory patrols - found a data disc in some ruins out in the waste.

topics.topic_text: Why aren't there any patrols anymore?
topics.response_text: Oh, there are patrols. Just not exploratory ones. We've been in a state of lockdown for... well, let's just say it's been a while.
Nah, it's not so bad. The world outside isn't exactly a paradise, you know? Still, you can only breathe recirculated air for so long.
Yeah, some Pre-War jackass with too much time on his hands apparently decided to inflict his misery on those around him.

topics.topic_text: Anything I can do to help?
topics.response_text: I suppose it couldn't hurt to get another pair of eyes on this. Maybe you'll be able to come up with something coming at it fresh.

topics.topic: VDialogueHiddenValleyHVScribeIbsenTopic006{Ask Ibsen about Hardin trying to become Elder}
topics.topic_text: What do you think of Hardin trying to get McNamara dismissed?
topics.response_text: {Testy, Frustrated}I don't have time to think about silly things like politics right now. My main concern right now is getting this blasted datastore up and running.

topics.topic_text: What do I need to do?
topics.response_text: You'll need to locate it on three different terminals in this area in one minute. Any longer and it'll jump, and you'll have to start all over.
That's... not really for me to say. It's a bit of a touchy subject. You should probably forget I mentioned it.
Please, don't let me stop you. I know what it's like to have a lot on your mind.
You and me both. The Elder wants this data store operational pronto, but it doesn't look like the damn thing will be working anytime soon.
I could use some assistance, sure, but I highly doubt you have the technical background to help us deal with this virus.

topics.topic_text: I'll give it a try, then.
topics.response_text: Best of luck to you. I'll tell the others to take a break so they don't get in your way. Oh, and I'll keep track of when it jumps for you.

topics.topic_text: Sounds complicated. I'll leave you to it.
topics.response_text: We'll get it eventually, but it's frustrating that it's taking so long.

topics.topic_text: Can the virus's files be partitioned so read-access is only provided by the kernel administrator?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] What? No, that... that's brilliant! It would let us seal a portion of the virus to a particular terminal, even when the other parts move.
I'm almost out of ideas, so you'd be more than welcome to.
All right. I'll monitor when it jumps. When I give the signal, start checking terminals.
We'll continue our own efforts in the meantime.

topics.topic_text: Not right now. I want to ask you a few questions.
topics.response_text: I suppose I could take a small break, but I can only spare a little time. Ask away.

topics.topic_text: What kind of information is in the datastore?
topics.response_text: {Excited, this is his favorite subject}Oh, all kinds of things! There was already information regarding the layout and systems of this bunker, but we've since added our own data as well.
Yes, did you have an idea that might help us?
I do that all the time myself. One moment I'll think I've solved the conundrum, and the next I'm back to square one. Don't let it bother you.

topics.topic_text: How do I get access to more topics in the datastore?
topics.response_text: Well, you'd have to get a senior-level member of the chapter to unlock a topic for you. I've given you access to what I can, but that's not much.

conversation.response_text: Damn, it's jumped! I thought we might have had it that time.
The virus just jumped! Find which terminals it went to!
That's it! We got it! The virus has been purged!

description:
Scribe Ibsen is a 47 year-old Caucasian Male.

A middle-aged Caucasian man with short-cropped brown hair and tired eyes, Scribe Ibsen serves as the data analyst for the Mojave Brotherhood of Steel. His glasses are constantly perched on his nose as he meticulously sorts through information in the Hidden Valley bunker. His uniform is clean but worn, showing signs of long hours spent at terminals.

Scribe Ibsen's Personality: Methodical, analytical, and somewhat introverted. Scribe Ibsen is dedicated to his work and takes pride in the Brotherhood's mission of preserving technology. He can be obsessive about data organization but is generally approachable if one doesn't interrupt his work.

Scribe Ibsen's Backstory: Born in the Midwest, Ibsen showed an early aptitude for information organization and data analysis. He was recruited by the Brotherhood of Steel in his early twenties and has since risen through the ranks to become a trusted scribe. His expertise in data retrieval and storage has made him invaluable to the Brotherhood's operations in the Mojave. He has spent most of his career in the Hidden Valley bunker, analyzing intelligence reports and maintaining the Brotherhood's database.
